metadata.dc:title: Edison's Prose Poem
metadata.dc:creator: Thomas Alva Edison
metadata.dc:subject: Poems and Songs
metadata.dc:description: Image of poem in prose written by Edison in a scrapbook, apparently in response to his public treatment at the hands of former business partner James Ashley, Edison wrote this rather fanciful description of "the foulest demon of the Cosmos".
metadata.dc:source: Digitized image of original black and white poem written by Thomas A. Edison
metadata.dc:rights: Thomas A. Edison National Historic Park grants Rutgers University the rights to publish
